alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 1:34AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 445 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 134 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Visalia, Porterville, Orosi, Lindsay, Farmersville, Exeter, Orange Cove, Woodlake, Ivanhoe, East Orosi, Cutler, Strathmore, Woodville, Poplar-Cotton Center, East Porterville, Lindcove, Lemon Cove, Squaw Valley and Springville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
